resources.string: I'm surprised to find anyone down here. \n\nAnyone living, that is.
You've washed ashore on the isle of Aeternum.\n\nIt's hard for me to even remember the Old World these days, but I know it was very different.
I hope it doesn't seem like life is just a misery here. Some people quite like it.\n\n And the weather here in Monarch's Bluffs is nice… most of the time.
I know you're probably wanting to head up to the settlement yourself, soon.\n\nI promise I won't keep you too much longer. It is nice to have company though.
Wherever you came from, {playerName}, they must be pretty tough there. \n\nI mean you're hardly here an hour, and you're already cleansing Corruption. That's pretty impressive, I'd say.
Yep, I'm still here. Still watching out for any further signs of Corruption.\n\nYou're welcome to stay and keep me company... if you like.
You're new to Aeternum, are you not?\n\nYes, you have that brightness about your eyes. I'm sorry to tell you, but it won't last.
The irony in this Corruption business is that an old madman warned us about it years ago.\n\nHe was right… it will get worse before it gets better. If it gets better at all, that is.
There is a great deal of work to do in Monarch's Bluffs.\n\nYou are capable, but are you willing to put settlement ahead of self?
This is just the beginning. From now on, you can visit me or the town board and take any tasks you desire. \n\nYour help will always be needed.
You know, I've been thinking about the threat of Corruption.\n\nOne thing that can at least give us some comfort, is that it will have to overrun Everfall before it gets to our doorstep.
We must simply hope this old man still retains enough sanity to tell us what he knows.\n\nWhether what he knows if of any value to us is another question entirely.
If the farms overrun by Withered still have healthy crops, then we must harvest them.\n\nWe might even be able to use this as leverage.
Thank you, {playerName}, but let's keep our stores of healthy foods quiet for now.\n\nWe can drive up demand, you know.
As you know, I had anticipated selling the Arruda Jam you acquired to our neighboring settlements.\n\nBut I have had a change of heart.
Thanks to you, we have begun to forge an alliance with our neighboring settlements.\n\nFor better or worse, we will be together in the fight against Corruption.
Your timing is either impeccable or it's miserably unfortunate. \n\nMonarch's Bluffs attracts those marked for strange fates, or so it seems.
Whether you realize it or not, I think you have come to help us here in Monarch's Bluffs. \n\nRight at the hour of our greatest need.
I've been thinking about how to best defend Monarch's Bluffs against Corruption.\n\nI think we can ill afford to pretend the situation is not dire.
I can understand if you have hesitation in committing to one of the factions.\n\nI can understand why it would be a difficult choice.
Strange as this island is, I've come to appreciate it.\n\nNot so much the eternal life, mind you. That part, I'm not always sure how I feel about it.
Monarch's Bluffs is a special place, a place where anyone can feel safe and welcome.\n\nRegardless of where they came from or even what kind of person they are.
Well, {playerName}, you have made more of an impact here in Monarch's Bluffs than I had imagined.\n\nWe're now apparently pursuing new alliances.
Magistrate Korrapati in Windsward sends her regards. \n\nYour attack on the Bloodheart Pirates has made all the difference. We are in your debt.
The forges of Monarch's Bluffs produce the finest weapons and armor in all Aeternum.\n\nThat is because I am in charge here.
The Constable is no stranger to darkness, and I do not doubt her resolve.\n\nBut I worry a settlement cannot stand on its own against this surge in Corruption.
I strongly believe an alliance between settlements is essential to battle the Corruption.\n\nShort of that, I will do what I can at the forge.
Hello there, my friend. I am glad to see you are still about town. Survivalist Thornton, as well.\n\nI still worry that we need more allies, however.
Of course, we have a shortage of armor strong enough to resist Corruption as well.\n\nI had despaired of finding a solution… until now.
It is a rare day when I must acknowledge someone else's skills surpass my own.\n\nAs a diplomat, I bow to your talent and wisdom. We are lucky to have you, {playerName}.
You know where I'd rather be? Out in the wilds.\n\nSitting around in this settlement is like watching a snail crawl across the road.
Look, I'll level with you.\n\nIf all hell breaks loose and the forces of Corruption march across Aeternum, I'd rather be out there than in here.
I've been calling this place home for more than a decade, you know.\n\nEven when you're roaming about, it's nice to think you have somewhere to go back to.
Hey {playerName}, how are things? I hear Bixford and Saville still got their heads up their butts.\n\nWe gotta do something.
So have you heard the latest catastrophe? All the crops are spoiled!\n\nEven if we do manage to defend against Corruption, we'll starve in here.
So Bixford and Saville finally pulled their heads out of their butts? \n\nMaybe I'll stick around a little longer, after all.
What'll it be, friend? A drink to wash away your sorrows, or a drink to celebrate the gift of life?\n\nThere's always a good reason to knock one back, if you ask me.
Hey, are you… {playerName}, the one I've been hearing about?\n\nYes, you must be. You match the description. People talk around here, you know.
You did me a good turn with my 'Devil's Honey.' \n\nI'm thinking I might have another favor to ask, if you've got the time.
I'm telling you, we're going to have a party!\n\nJust not quite yet. Good things come to those who wait…
Bad news, {playerName}. The feast is called off.\n\nThe honeycakes and wine will have to be rationed. We're facing a food shortage.
This is really a brain-buster, isn't it? The crops grown near the settlement are spoiled again and again lately.\n\nI just want a decent meal, you know?
I hear our little present to the Barkeep in Windsward turned into a quite a thing.\n\nWe make a good team, me and you.
We are forged in the fire and quenched in the blood of battle. Only the strong and brave can be Marauders.
Do you seek the glory and riches of battle? If you possess the fortitude, you may become one of us.
Go on and look into the other factions. You will see that the Syndicate are weak, and the Covenant, naïve.
That's the upright posture of a proud warrior. I stand ready to accept your allegiance.
Typical of the Syndicate to get in over your heads. Best learn to swim as you'll get no help from me.
I harbor no ill will, cultist. Though I feel uneasy when your Adjudicator is near. Her eyes, they seem to drill right through me.
You have proven your determination, now demonstrate your loyalty.\n\nIf you are serious about the Marauders, I have a challenge to offer you.
We are strongest together. Let us endeavor to bring victory to the Marauders.
The leaders of this Settlement don't want you to know the truth about Corruption. Don't let them deceive you.
You wish to learn the secrets that only the Syndicate have uncovered, don't you?
As much as it pains me, you should talk to the other factions to discover how dense they are. Then you will see that you belong with the Syndicate.
I see your skeptical expression. That is the hallmark of an Alchemist! Doubt, investigate, reveal the hidden truth! That is our way.
Ok, Marauder. The name is "Tuit", not "twit". And tell that child of Commander that he needs to grow up.
It is you and your cult who are missing the plot. The Syndicate will reveal all in due time.
Ah ha! You have been convinced to leave the flock and learn the truth. \n\nBut first, I have a challenge for you.
I humbly greet you, truth seeker.
May the Spark grant you mercy and protection, friend.
The Covenant shares its light with all, so as to lead all men from darkness. Will you carry the light with us?
It would be wise to learn of the other factions here before chosing the Covenant. \n\nBut watch out for that rascal, Purcell of the Marauders. His charisma may lead you astray.
I see the light of wisdom in you. Your righteous path is with the Covenant, I can see this as clear as day.
You're a Marauder, yes? So tell me how is Rodger…Commander Purcell? Is he in good health?
What type of fantasy are you weaving yourself today? So much focus on searching for something that is right under your nose.
We take our vow seriously as members of the Covenant. May you resist temptation, which is no easy feat.\n\nWe have an important mission for you, assuming you're fully committed.
The light of the Covenant shines within you.
Welcome to 'The Regent's Rise'! Sleep here and wake up feeling like a king!\n\nYou here to check in? Be my guest… literally!
You've become a real regular around here, haven't you? Hope this place is starting to feel like home.\n\nSay though, are you more of a townie? Or do you venture out into the great beyond?
Now that you caught a glimpse of First Light, I hope you still feel loyal to Monarch's Bluffs.\n\nThe Regent's Rise is always ready to roll out the finest carpets for you!
I've heard the talk around town, people saying things are safer around here.\n\nNot sure I believe it. I might just pick up and head south one of these days.
You know, I'm never one to turn away a good paying customer.\n\nBut you've been here long enough - might want to look into buying a house, making this permanent.
Greetings. I am Master Fisher Warwick.
Greetings. I am Master Fisher Warwick. What have you got there?
Good to see you, recruit! Er, I mean, student!
